humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the pathology report, the patient has metastatic infiltrating duct carcinoma in one sentinel lymph node (1/1) and no evidence of metastatic mammary carcinoma in the other 14 lymph nodes (0/14). Based on the new rules provided, N1 indicates metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes. Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N1.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text:
The N stage for cancer is determined by the presence and extent of cancer spread to nearby lymph nodes. In this pathology report, the relevant information for lymph node involvement is as follows:

- Right sentinel lymph node number 1: No evidence of metastatic mammary carcinoma (0/1)
- Right sentinel lymph node number 2: No evidence of metastatic mammary carcinoma (0/1)
- Right sentinel lymph node number 3: Metastatic infiltrating duct carcinoma, 4.0 mm maximum metastasis dimension without pericapsular invasion, involving one lymph node (1/1)
- Right sentinel lymph node number 4: No evidence of metastatic mammary carcinoma (0/1)
- Axillary contents, right, dissection: No evidence of metastatic mammary carcinoma in fourteen lymph nodes (0/14)

Based on this information, the patient has metastasis in one out of the 18 examined lymph nodes (1/18). Therefore, the N stage is N1, which indicates cancer has spread to 1-3 axillary lymph nodes or in internal mammary nodes with or without axillary lymph nodes.
